text: MATERIAL OF CHANGES
CCDM 33.3.7.2 was revised to incorporate procedures for the review and clearance of tax forms, instructions, and publications by the Office of Chief Counsel that were published in CC Notice
Table of
Tax Publications, and Public Use Forms

) The Tax Forms and Publications Division, W:CAR:MP:T, is responsible for program of tax forms and tax publications. The focus of this section is on the activities of the Office of Chief Counsel and its representative to the Tax Coordinating Committee (the Committee). (

) Tax forms and instructions combine the technical and administrative require- ments of all functions of the Service, and are often the only contact between the Service and the taxpayer. All functions of the Service are represented. Chief Counsel, one person from the Office of the Associate Chief Counsel (Procedure & Administration) is designated as its representative on the Committee. The Committee, among its duties, reviews and approves all tax forms. (

) The Office of Chief Counsel is responsible for advising the Committee on current developments in legislation, regulations, litigation, and other legal the aspects of forms and instructions. In the development of tax forms and tions, the Office of Chief Counsel is also responsible for the technical of interpretations of legislation for which regulations have not been published and of regulations which are in the process of being amended. It is for interpreting the applicable Code sections and for reviewing the forms and instructions. (

) The Chief Counsel representative to the Committee is the Counsel contact any Service office that has a question about which Counsel office to contact they need advice on the development or revision of a form. (

) Each Associate and Division Counsel Office should designate a person to serve as the Tax Forms and Publications Coordinator, and another person to serve as the backup Coordinator, for review and clearance of tax forms, in- for structions, and publications (tax products) for their office. These representatives will meet on a regular basis to determine in advance, on a product by product basis: a. The Associate Office that has primary responsibility for clearing each tax product on behalf of Counsel, and b. The tax product that each Associate and Division Counsel Office would like to review on coordination because the tax product impacts their office’s subject matter jurisdiction or client programs. (
) As new tax products are developed, they will be referred to each office’s sentative to determine primary and secondary responsibility for clearance review. (

) The list identifying primary responsibility and secondary interest among Associate and Division Counsel for clearance and review of recurring tax products will be provided to the Technical Services Support Branch D:TSS) to facilitate case opening and assignment. (

) The Tax Forms & Publications Division will send all tax forms, publications, instructions, along with the accompanying Document Clearance Record, to Technical Services Support Branch at Forms & Publications — Counsel Review, which is a dedicated mailbox for Counsel review of tax forms and lications. The Technical Services Support Branch will open a primary item to the Associate Office named on the list as having responsibility for Chief Counsel Directives Manual
Forms, Tax Publications, and Public Use Forms 33.3.7 page 1
As new tax products are developed, they will be referred to each office’s repre- sentative to determine primary and secondary responsibility for clearance and

clearing the product on behalf of Counsel and assistance workload items for the offices that wish to review that product on coordination. a. To facilitate the tracking of Counsel’s review and clearance of tax products, cases will be opened using a naming convention that reflects year of the product and the name of the product (for example, “
Tax Product Review, Form
−MISC”). b. The Associate Office with primary responsibility will provide consolidated comments on behalf of Counsel to the Tax Forms & Publications Division within
days of the date of receipt in the Technical Services Support Branch. The standard time period for Counsel review of all tax products will be

days. The Technical Services Support Branch will enter due dates in CASE−MIS based on this standard. For this reason, assistance workload items will be assigned a due date five work days before the date of the primary assignment. The primary office may grant an office additional time for review as long as the extension does not preclude a timely response to the Tax Forms & Publications Division. c. For products requiring expedited (non−standard) review, the office with primary responsibility will negotiate an appropriate comment period with the Tax Forms & Publications Division and will inform the Technical Services Support Branch of the negotiated due date. The primary office has authority to consolidate review requirements as necessary or ate for expedited review. d. The Technical Services Support Branch will create paper files for the Associate Counsel Offices with primary responsibility. (

) The Technical Services Support Branch will send an email acknowledgment receipt to: a. The Tax Forms & Publications Division indicating the assignment to the Associate Office with primary responsibility, the name of that office’s Tax Forms & Publications Coordinator and the backup Coordinator, and the assigned due date for response. b. The Tax Forms & Publications Coordinator for the Associate Office with primary responsibility and the Associate and Division Counsel Coordina- tors assigned workload items, and a copy to the backup Coordinator. email should attach an electronic version of the tax product and include the TECHMIS number of the tax product and the due date for the combined response to Tax Forms & Publications, as well as the due date for the workload items. (

) Each Associate and Division Counsel will review the assigned tax product designate all changes as either a legally required change (i.e., change that affects the substance of or technical meaning of the text) or a recommended change (i.e., one that is nonsubstantive or discretionary that would include stylistic or editorial changes not affecting the technical meaning of the text). (

) The Associate Office assigned primary responsibility will: a. Collect comments (designated as either legally required or recommended changes) from the offices who asked to review the item on coordination b. Consolidate the comments (designated as either legally required or mended changes) into one document c. If there are legally required changes, prepare a memorandum addressing the need for these changes and providing Counsel−wide concurrence subject to the legally required changes being made by Tax Forms & Chief Counsel Directives Manual Cat. cations, and forward the document and the memorandum to Tax Publications (see paragraph

below for further instructions on legally required changes) d. Maintain a copy of all documents forwarded to Tax Forms & (

) To the extent that there is no disagreement, it is expected that the Tax & Publications Division will make the legally required changes. If Tax Forms Publications disagrees with a legally required change, Tax Forms & tions will contact the office with primary responsibility to reconcile any difference of opinion. Differences that cannot be resolved by the office with primary responsibility will be elevated to the appropriate levels. If that office not provide the legally required change at issue, the primary office should ordinate with the commenting office in working through the issue with Tax Forms & Publications. (

) Tax Forms & Publications will provide the primary Associate Office with a Document Clearance Record and a “final draft” of the tax product to that all agreed legally required changes have been made. It should be rare that an office will ask for additional legally required changes after receiving “final draft” if the agreed changes have been made. The primary Associate Office will then sign the Document Clearance Record on behalf of Chief Counsel understanding that the document is moving to print status. These procedures do not preclude an Associate or Division Counsel Office from working informally with Tax Forms & Publications Division during the velopment of a tax product. However, all final comments must be made through the primary Associate Office to Tax Forms & Publications Division under the formal review and clearance process. In addition, Associate and Division Counsel Offices are encouraged to coordinate with Treasury upon receipt of an assignment from the Technical Services Support Branch to the extent that there is a tax policy or statutory interpretation issue or matter relating to the tax product.

Forms & Publications will provide the primary Associate Office with a Clearance Record and a “final draft” of the tax product to confirm all agreed legally required changes have been made. It should be rare an office will ask for additional legally required changes after receiving the draft” if the agreed changes have been made. The primary Associate will then sign the Document Clearance Record on behalf of Chief understanding that the document is moving to print status.
